我虽然没有经历OW那16年的夏天，
但是相遇在OW那21年的秋天，
仍清晰记得自己不会瞄准只会抡锤的当年，
为朋友撑盾闯过努巴尼，
托马斯一头撞死人的快感，
看着OW最后的全家福度过了秋天。
22年冬，我和他们在艾兴瓦尔德取得的最后的五连胜，
在月球基地与他和她合过的最后一张照，
然后，一切就完了。

明明一个回忆，却被暴雪折磨得不想回望，

OW1 was great. It only died due to the lack of new content for several years. All Blizzard needed to do was put effort into content and game updates to keep the game alive.

Instead, Blizzard releases OW2 which is essentially a reskin of OW1 that removes many of the features that players loved about Overwatch (LOOT BOXES), and replaced them with micro-transactions at every corner. They constantly break the balance of the game by frequently "reworking" heroes. Not to mention that it is difficult to learn a hero or learn how to counter a hero when every few weeks, they change how that hero works.

Season 6 was truly insulting. They hype up the story missions for weeks leading up to the start of season 6 only to find that you need to pay $20 just to access these story missions. To some degree, I understand paying for the battle pass and skins because those are entirely cosmetic and has no effect on the game itself. But what's the point of making a game "free to play" if you're going to put core content of a game (such as a story mode) behind a paywall? I just feel like I shouldn't need to pay to access something that should be included in the base game.

OW2 needs to stop with the micro-transactions and start rewarding players for actually playing the game. Even when I sit down and complete the battle pass for an entire season, all I get is a bunch of skins, emotes, voice lines, etc. that I already technically paid for when I purchased the battle pass.

The original game that was once fun and had potential got stripped of features and filled to the brim with microtransactions.

They also consciously lied before release to drive engagement by promising a fully fledged PvE mode with talent trees and progression, just to announce that it was cancelled in favor of more battlepass crap.

This is Blizzard's last attempt to milk the playerbase before it meets the same fate as Heroes of the Storm.

不行啊，首先，游戏的平衡性一直是一个问题。在游戏中有多种角色可供选择，每个角色都有自己的技能和特点。然而，某些角色的技能过于强大，导致游戏中的一些战斗变得不公平。这使得游戏变得无趣和不公正，给那些想要公平竞争的玩家带来了极大的挫败感。

其次，游戏的匹配系统存在问题。在游戏中，玩家通过匹配系统与其他玩家组队进行对战。然而，这个系统经常无法很好地匹配玩家的技能水平，导致一些对战变得极为不平衡。有时候你会被匹配到与你技能水平相差悬殊的玩家，这使得游戏体验变得非常糟糕。

此外，游戏缺乏内容更新。尽管游戏最初推出时有一些新的角色和地图，但随着时间的推移，Blizzard Entertainment的更新速度变得非常慢。这导致游戏变得单调乏味，缺乏新鲜感，玩家们很快就会对游戏失去兴趣。

最后，游戏存在一些技术问题。在游戏中，玩家经常会遇到连接问题、卡顿和延迟等技术故障。这些问题不仅影响了游戏的流畅性，还破坏了玩家的游戏体验。作为一款多人在线游戏，稳定的连接是至关重要的，但《守望先锋》在这方面做得并不好。

总的来说，尽管《守望先锋》在发布时引起了很大的轰动，但它存在一些令人失望的方面。游戏的平衡性问题、匹配系统的不公平、缺乏内容更新以及技术故障都导致了游戏的质量下降。希望Blizzard Entertainment能够关注并改进这些问题，以提供更好的游戏体验。
